intro: Scirpus brachyantherus, commonly known as the broad-leaved bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and broad, flat leaves that form dense clusters. Its flowers are small and clustered in spike-like inflorescences, typically appearing in late summer to early fall. Scirpus brachyantherus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
